word:
A Few Weeks After James White's Death.--I miss Father more and more. Especially do I feel his loss while here in the mountains. I find it a very different thing being in the mountains with my husband and in the mountains without him. I am fully of the opinion
274
that my life was so entwined or interwoven with my husband's that it is about impossible for me to be of any great account without him.--Letter 17, 1881.
